summary: This document is an internal Deutsche Bank email chain from August 2015 regarding an AML (Anti-Money Laundering) compliance inquiry into 17 wire transfers totaling $379,315.06 from Jeffrey Epstein's account to various recipients. A compliance officer requests details on the purpose, relationships, and source of funds, and a bank employee provides responses based on information from the client (Epstein).

persons.name: Cherie Quigley
persons.role: Wealth Management AML Compliance Officer at Deutsche Bank
persons.context: Deutsche Bank AML compliance officer who initiates the inquiry into wire transfers from Jeffrey Epstein's account and requests detailed explanations for the transactions.

persons.name: Amanda Kirby
persons.role: Employee at Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas
persons.context: Deutsche Bank employee who relays responses from the client (Jeffrey Epstein) regarding the purpose and nature of the wire transfers to the AML compliance inquiry.

persons.name: Paul Morris
persons.role: Managing Director at Deutsche Bank Private Bank
persons.context: Deutsche Bank Managing Director who is copied on the AML compliance inquiry email chain regarding Jeffrey Epstein's account.

persons.name: Wayne Salit
persons.role: Recipient copied on email (likely Deutsche Bank employee)
persons.context: Individual copied on the internal Deutsche Bank email chain regarding the AML inquiry into Jeffrey Epstein's account.

persons.name: Ying-A Wang
persons.role: Recipient of forwarded email (likely Deutsche Bank employee)
persons.context: Recipient of a forwarded version of the AML inquiry email chain in 2016.

persons.name: Kripa Arya
persons.role: Recipient of forwarded email (likely Deutsche Bank employee)
persons.context: Recipient of a forwarded version of the AML inquiry email chain in 2016.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.role: Client of Deutsche Bank, subject of AML inquiry
persons.context: The client whose account is under review for 17 wire transfers. The bank's responses describe the purposes of the wires (e.g., maid reimbursement, contractor payment, friend assistance) and state his wealth originated from Bear Stearns and his own firm.

persons.name: Mihai Serban
persons.context: Recipient of wires from Jeffrey Epstein's account, identified as a painting contractor paid for invoices.

connections.description: Epstein sent wire payments to Mihai Serban for painting contractor services, as indicated by invoice payments.
Kirby, as a Deutsche Bank employee, communicated with or on behalf of client Epstein to gather information for an AML compliance inquiry regarding his wire transfers.
Quigley (AML Compliance) requested information from Kirby (Wealth Management) regarding Epstein's account activity as part of a bank internal investigation.
Morris (Managing Director) forwarded the AML inquiry to Kirby and was copied on the email chain regarding Epstein's account.

events.title: Series of Wire Transfers from Epstein's Account
events.description: Seventeen (17) wire transfers totaling $379,315.06 were sent from Jeffrey Epstein's Deutsche Bank account to various recipients, triggering an internal AML compliance review.

events.title: Deutsche Bank AML Compliance Inquiry
events.description: Internal Deutsche Bank emails show AML compliance officer Cherie Quigley investigating the purpose of Epstein's wire transfers, with responses provided by Amanda Kirby based on client information.

locations: 345 Park Avenue, 24th Fl, New York, NY 10154-0004 (Deutsche Bank Trust Company Americas office)
60 Wall Street, New York, NY 10005-2836 (Deutsche Bank Private Wealth Management AML Compliance office)
New York, NY (Location of apartment building managed by 301/66 Owners Corp where Epstein owned units)
keyFacts: Deutsche Bank's AML compliance system flagged 17 wire transfers totaling $379,315.06 from Jeffrey Epstein's account between November 2013 and December 2014 for review.

Bank-provided explanations for the wires included: reimbursement to a household maid of 22 years, payments to painting contractor Mihai Serban, money for a friend's daughter's dentist, money for a friend's school, payments to interior decorator SLK Designs, and condo fees.
The source of funds for the wires was described as Epstein's personal wealth, accumulated from his time at Bear Stearns in the 1980s and as founder of a financial management firm.
The document is marked 'CONFIDENTIAL - PURSUANT TO FED. R. CRIM. P. 6(e)', indicating it was part of grand jury or related criminal proceedings.
The email chain was forwarded in 2016, suggesting ongoing relevance or review of the matter within the bank.
